pynanovna.pynanovna.NanoVNAWorker

class NanoVNAWorker(vna_index=0, verbose=False)[source]

Bases: object

Initialize a NanoVNA object.

Args:

vna_index (int): Number of NanoVNAs to connect, at the moment multiple VNAs are not supported. Defaults to 0. verbose (bool): Print information. Defaults to False.

Methods

calibrate

Run the calibration guide and calibrate the NanoVNA.

kill

Disconnect the NanoVNA.

save_csv

Function to save the stream to a csv file.

set_sweep

Set the sweep parameters.

single_sweep

stream_data

Creates a data stream from the continuous sweeping.
calibrate(load_file=False, savefile=None)[source]

Run the calibration guide and calibrate the NanoVNA.

Args:

load_file (bool, optional): Path to existing calibration. Defaults to False. savefile (path): Path to save the calibration. Defaults to None.

kill()[source]

Disconnect the NanoVNA.

Raises:

Exception: If the NanoVNA was not successfully disconnected.

save_csv(filename, skip_start=5, sweepdivider='Sweepno')[source]

Function to save the stream to a csv file.

Args:

filename (str): The filename to save to. nr_sweeps (int): Number of sweeps to run. Defaults to 10. skip_start (int): The NanoVNA usually gives bad data in the beginning, therefore this data can be skipped. Defaults to 5.

Raises:

TypeError: If the filename is not a string.

set_sweep(start, stop, segments, points)[source]

Set the sweep parameters.

Args:

start (int): The start frequnecy. stop (int): The stop frequency. segments (int): Number of segments. points (int): Number of points.

stream_data(data_file=False, start_delay=2.0)[source]

Creates a data stream from the continuous sweeping. (Or a previously recorded file.)

Args:

data_file (string): Path to a previously recorded csv file to stream from. Defaults to False. start_delay (float): Time to wait for the stream to start before yielding values.

Yields:

list: Yields a list of data when new data is available.
